item.title: Docs: Raspberry Pi 4
item.description:
Follow the SD Card preparation step and insert that card into Raspberry Pi 4, then, without plugging anywhere, power it from USB-C port.

Then follow the Wi-Fi Configuration.

The board will connect to your Wi-Fi and will start downloading ~2Gb docker image which will definitely take some time. While waiting, I recommend figuring out IP of the mower from router DHCP leases and opening SSH connection.

ðŸ”‘ Default SSH credentials

Username: openmower, password: openmower.

Running sudo systemctl status --no-pager -l -n 99999 openmower should display something reassuring.

If you are lazy, just wait 5-10 minutes and check that http://<openmower IP>:8080/ is accessible. If it’s not, you need to SSH and check the logs with sudo journalctl -fu openmower. Usually a problem would be bad config file.

If you got to the webapp - you are good. Plug the Raspberry Pi back to mainboard.
